project.teaser: Manufacturing and logistics companies are subject to unforeseen events that disrupt the supply chain, causing production slowdowns, reduced output, and increased costs, making it difficult to meet customer demand. To mitigate these risks, manufacturers must build resilience...
project.objective: Manufacturing and logistics companies are subject to unforeseen events that disrupt the supply chain, causing production slowdowns, reduced output, and increased costs, making it difficult to meet customer demand. To mitigate these risks, manufacturers must build resilience across entire value chains. NARRATE will develop a sophisticated tool using AI, Digital Twin, and IoT technologies allowing end-to-end visibility and control over supply chain operations to monitor and predict potential disruptions, enabling supply chains to achieve improved resilience. The Intelligent Manufacturing Custodian (IMC) will leverage data from various production sources to enable proactive decision-making and act as a nerve centre for a supply-chain network, providing real-time monitoring and coordination of intelligent production processes and logistics. Integrating an IMC into a supply-chain will evolve its operations into Smart Manufacturing Network (SMN): a connected and self-orchestrated ecosystem linked end-to-end with programmable Manufacturing-as-a-Service capabilities that can withstand disruptions. A Digital Twin will provide a reliable model to represent production and operational data of an SMN to unlock deeper IMC intelligence. Collected data will train machine learning models to predict potential disruptions, such as natural disasters or delayed shipments. AI algorithms will analyse the data and provide real-time reporting and visualization on a dashboard. The IMC and Digital Twin interaction will generate powerful insights and self-adapting abilities that support an SMN to evolve under human supervision by switching services between multiple external partners to respond to risks and disruptions and improve energy efficiency, product circularity and environmental sustainability across the entire production process. The effectiveness of NARRATE will be evaluated by testing the IMC in real production environments in quite diverse industry sectors.
project.title: regeNerAtive Resilient smaRt mAnufacTuring nEtworks
project.keywords: supply chain resilience, Manufacturing as a service, digital twins, Artificial intelligence, IoT, data contextualisation, Smart Manufacturing Network, AI Platform, disruption and risk detection

article.title: A closer look at the challenge and innovation of supply chain disruptions

result.title: NARRATE technology roadmap
result.description: D8.2 reports on the activities that coordinate the technical work and monitor the technical evolution and progress of NARRATE diagnosing evolving market needs and continuously updating the main goals of the project as it is being carried out. It is related to T8.2 and will be updated in the different progress reports.

result.title: Architectural Requirements
result.description: Related to T1.4, D1.4 develops a reference architecture based on agile principles that contributes to resilient supply chain activities that meets the users' needs and expectations. It will promote a style that supports platform independence, open-source software and use of non-proprietary technologies.

result.title: End-to-end AI-driven visibility model & support DSS (a)
result.description: D4.2(a) develops knowledge models to represent the structure and relationships of the SMN based on extensions of the neuro-symbolic DSS in D3.3. These knowledge models provide a comprehensive view of the entire SMN, including suppliers, manufacturers, logistics providers, and customers. It is related to T4.2.

result.title: Energy efficiency & circularity
result.description: Related to T1.3, D1.3 addresses the requirements of assessing process circularity, energy efficiency, carbon footprint, industrial symbiosis and other sustainability aspects of the supply chain. It develops environmental and circularity KPIs in order to select the best procurement alternatives from the assessed suppliers.

result.title: Stakeholders engagement, Dissemination, communication & training plan
result.description: D7.1 defines the overall communication strategy and plan for the project, refining target audiences, key messages and channels. This deliverable includes a plan for the whole project, with major phases and specific activities to ensure an impactful engagement of stakeholders. It also presents an online discussion forum to support continuous learning.it is related to T7.1 and will be updated in the different progress reports.

result.title: Technology Roadmap for Resilient Smart Manufacturing Ecosystems

details.authors: Michael P. Papazoglou, Bernd J. Krämer, Maria Jose Núñez Ariño, Amal Elgammal
details.journalTitle: 2024 IEEE International Conference on Engineering, Technology, and Innovation (ICE/ITMC)

result.title: Resilience Strategy & Tool (a)
result.description: Related to T2.1. D2.1(a) develops Resilience Strategies for ensuring the stability & continuity of smart manufacturing networks and understanding of disruptive threats, and classification of disruptive events.

result.title: Project Requirements
result.description: D1.1 defines the requirements of users of the AI Platform, software developers, pilot participants and other interested parties and each use case including business process specification, user stories including functional, operational and performance requirements. Related to T1.1

result.title: Pilot Analysis
result.description: D1.2 includes the planning and setting up of the pilots and scenarios including validation criteria and KPIs. A work plan and timeline will be developed to guide the pilots´ implementation being the basis for their validation in WP5. Related to T1.2

result.title: Digital Twin design & development (a)
result.description: D3.2 (a) designs a set of self-describing, actionable Digital Twin (DT) knowledge frames that leverage contextualized data in T3.1 and use advanced analytics & Machine Learning to model a smart manufacturing network. It is related to T3.2.

result.title: Resilience, Sustainability & Circularity Stress Testing Tool (a)
result.description: D4.1(a) develops a tool that identifies vulnerabilities and strengthens the SMN ecosystems resilience to minimize the impact of and recovery from unexpected events.

result.title: Technical progress report
result.description: This deliverable includes an update of all the technical work up to M9.

result.title: Pilot planning report - early pilot demonstrator (a)
result.description: D5.1 (a) defines the pilot trials and demonstrators´ requirements considering the distinctiveness of the scope of each industrial domain in the project to boost the early availability of the platform, arranging the necessary evaluation steps for testing, assessing and validating them.The deliverable is related to T5.1.

result.title: Design & implementation of Contextualization services (a)
result.description: D3.1(a) designs a context that faithfully represents production data and operational events spread across different production sites within a smart manufacturing network in a reusable structure grounded in open standards using data categorisation and metadata tagging.

result.title: Web-presence & online channels/portal
result.description: Related to T7.1, D7.2 establishes NARRATE’s branding (logo, fonts, colour palette), and presents the project’s website and social media channels (starting with YouTube and LinkedIn).

category.title: internet of things
category.displayCode: /natural sciences/computer and information sciences/internet/internet of things

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
